content: "http://www.streetprophets.com/storyonly/2009/5/6/20453/45392" Fram Pastor Dan at Street Prophets: quote: This is disturbing: quote: "http://www.abcnews.go.com/Politics/story?id=7513343&page=1" New research shows young Americans are dramatically less likely to go to church - or to participate in any form of organized religion - than their parents and grandparents. "It's a huge change," says Harvard University professor Robert Putnam, who conducted the research. Historically, the percentage of Americans who said they had no religious affiliation (pollsters refer to this group as the "nones") has been very small - hovering between 5 percent and 10 percent. However, Putnam says the percentage of "nones" has now skyrocketed to between 30 percent and 40 percent among younger Americans. Oh, wait. That's not the disturbing part. This is: quote: While these young "nones" may not belong to a church, they are not necessarily atheists. "Many of them are people who would otherwise be in church," Putnam said. "They have the same attitidues and values as people who are in church, but they grew up in a period in which being religious meant being politically conservative, especially on social issues." Putnam says that in the past two decades, many young people began to view organized religion as a source of "intolerance and rigidity and doctrinaire political views," and therefore stopped going to church. There's been some question about the validity of self-reported church attendance numbers: we know that it tends to be overstated, but nobody's really sure by how much. So it's possible that this reflects a new willingness to state the truth, rather than new behavior per se. But in general, thanks a lot, Religious Right. Not only did you help screw up this country by propping up a bunch of venal sociopaths and helping them win election after election, but you also helped undermine the very religion you claimed to defend by convincing an entire generation that it was made up of hateful, narrow bigots. Way to go. Well done, good and faithful servants.

content: Jesus went to the gentiles. He healed the servant of a Roman Centurian. He spoke to the woman at the well, one of the reviled by the Pharisies, Samaritans. His tale of the Good Samaritan concerned the ritual observing Pharasy and the priestly Levite leaving the man to die on the side of the road for fear of ritual uncleanness on the spproaching Sabbath, rather than attend the human needs of the wounded man. To which would you ascribe the the greater charity? To which would you ascribe the character of following the "laws" in spirit, rather than to the letter!! That WAS, and IS, the message of Christ, then and now. Hollow ritual, meaningless observances, or the Godly concern of one human being for another, as addressed in the ten commandments. All through history we can see the difference by Christians, and others of any religion, straying from this simple fact!! Hollow empty observance of ritual and the complete LOSS of the meaning of Christ and all He did and gave to the human race by His simple teachings. All the laws of men are meaningless without simple HUMANITY!!! The spirit of God given to ALL of us at birth and forgotten in the observances of men!! T

content: quote: Originally posted by tawodi: Jesus went to the gentiles. He healed the servant of a Roman Centurian. He spoke to the woman at the well, one of the reviled by the Pharisies, Samaritans. His tale of the Good Samaritan concerned the ritual observing Pharasy and the priestly Levite leaving the man to die on the side of the road for fear of ritual uncleanness on the spproaching Sabbath, rather than attend the human needs of the wounded man. The story of the Samaritan is a vile example of Jesus' hatred for his people or his ignorance of the law. Remember, the story never happened it was a TALE. The actual teachings of the Law is that saving a life is above Shabbath. In other words, it is commanded TO BRAKE SHABBATH in orther to save other's life. Someone asked if Jesus lied, well... A sin of omission by Jesus? The TALE of the Samaritan had a purpose, to perpetuate the idea that Jews cannot possible be close to G-d with their human-made rituals! To which would you ascribe the the greater charity? Since this did not happened... who cares! And since the story had the purpose to teach that EVERYONE is capable of compassion exept the Jews, you cannot possible in good faith decide that a person that hates his own people is worth much. To which would you ascribe the character of following the "laws" in spirit, rather than to the letter!! Not to Jesus for sure, since he and his teachings are based on open hatred for his own, which BTW is against the Law. What does it mean the spirit of the law and the letter of the law? That is Paul's teachings. Furthermore, how do you know what you are following (the letter or the spirit) if you ignore the basic contents of the law. Such as the fact that Shabbath has to be broken to save a life? That WAS, and IS, the message of Christ, then and now. That is why Jesus was so far from G-d, for he did not understand the Law of the L-rd: " 1 HAPPY IS the man that hath not walked in the counsel of the wicked, nor stood in the way of sinners, nor sat in the seat of the scornful. 2 But his delight is in the law of HaShem; and in His law doth he meditate day and night..." .......... T Ixcatl

content: "http://www.streetprophets.com/storyonly/2009/5/6/20453/45392" Fram Pastor Dan at Street Prophets: quote: This is disturbing: quote: "http://www.abcnews.go.com/Politics/story?id=7513343&page=1" New research shows young Americans are dramatically less likely to go to church - or to participate in any form of organized religion - than their parents and grandparents. "It's a huge change," says Harvard University professor Robert Putnam, who conducted the research. Historically, the percentage of Americans who said they had no religious affiliation (pollsters refer to this group as the "nones") has been very small - hovering between 5 percent and 10 percent. However, Putnam says the percentage of "nones" has now skyrocketed to between 30 percent and 40 percent among younger Americans. Oh, wait. That's not the disturbing part. This is: quote: While these young "nones" may not belong to a church, they are not necessarily atheists. "Many of them are people who would otherwise be in church," Putnam said. "They have the same attitidues and values as people who are in church, but they grew up in a period in which being religious meant being politically conservative, especially on social issues." Putnam says that in the past two decades, many young people began to view organized religion as a source of "intolerance and rigidity and doctrinaire political views," and therefore stopped going to church. There's been some question about the validity of self-reported church attendance numbers: we know that it tends to be overstated, but nobody's really sure by how much. So it's possible that this reflects a new willingness to state the truth, rather than new behavior per se. But in general, thanks a lot, Religious Right. Not only did you help screw up this country by propping up a bunch of venal sociopaths and helping them win election after election, but you also helped undermine the very religion you claimed to defend by convincing an entire generation that it was made up of hateful, narrow bigots. Way to go. Well done, good and faithful servants.

Jason As a follower of Jesus Christ, I am happy to see that some atheists are trying to step forward and form communities of mutual help and support (in doing so, they may end up unintentionally acting like actual Christians should act ). hope not to offend but I have known alot of xtians that need to take a class on how to act from atheists, most that i have known are more willing to help with out preaching. No I am not atheist but I once was xtian (no longer)Thank G-D this has been my personal observance so I guess this is just MHO. D.J. However, just as Christians have to be vigilant and deal with arrogant, "my way or the highway" Christians, the atheist community needs to be vigilant and deal with arrogant, "my way or the highway" atheists. (I ran into one just last week - a young college student spouting the line that anyone who believes in any religion of any kind is mentally ill and needs to be institutionalized and put under a doctor's care and that anyone who claims to be an agnostic is really an atheist who's a wimp.)
reply: Yep I've known some of them also ( not many but a few) Most of the atheist just dont want to be preached at while they are enjoying a good cup-o-coffiee. JMHO D.J.

content: Jesus went to the gentiles. He healed the servant of a Roman Centurian. He spoke to the woman at the well, one of the reviled by the Pharisies, Samaritans. His tale of the Good Samaritan concerned the ritual observing Pharasy and the priestly Levite leaving the man to die on the side of the road for fear of ritual uncleanness on the spproaching Sabbath, rather than attend the human needs of the wounded man. To which would you ascribe the the greater charity? To which would you ascribe the character of following the "laws" in spirit, rather than to the letter!! That WAS, and IS, the message of Christ, then and now. Hollow ritual, meaningless observances, or the Godly concern of one human being for another, as addressed in the ten commandments. All through history we can see the difference by Christians, and others of any religion, straying from this simple fact!! Hollow empty observance of ritual and the complete LOSS of the meaning of Christ and all He did and gave to the human race by His simple teachings. All the laws of men are meaningless without simple HUMANITY!!! The spirit of God given to ALL of us at birth and forgotten in the observances of men!! T

content: quote: Originally posted by tawodi: Jesus went to the gentiles. He healed the servant of a Roman Centurian. He spoke to the woman at the well, one of the reviled by the Pharisies, Samaritans. His tale of the Good Samaritan concerned the ritual observing Pharasy and the priestly Levite leaving the man to die on the side of the road for fear of ritual uncleanness on the spproaching Sabbath, rather than attend the human needs of the wounded man. The story of the Samaritan is a vile example of Jesus' hatred for his people or his ignorance of the law. Remember, the story never happened it was a TALE. The actual teachings of the Law is that saving a life is above Shabbath. In other words, it is commanded TO BRAKE SHABBATH in orther to save other's life. Someone asked if Jesus lied, well... A sin of omission by Jesus? The TALE of the Samaritan had a purpose, to perpetuate the idea that Jews cannot possible be close to G-d with their human-made rituals! To which would you ascribe the the greater charity? Since this did not happened... who cares! And since the story had the purpose to teach that EVERYONE is capable of compassion exept the Jews, you cannot possible in good faith decide that a person that hates his own people is worth much. To which would you ascribe the character of following the "laws" in spirit, rather than to the letter!! Not to Jesus for sure, since he and his teachings are based on open hatred for his own, which BTW is against the Law. What does it mean the spirit of the law and the letter of the law? That is Paul's teachings. Furthermore, how do you know what you are following (the letter or the spirit) if you ignore the basic contents of the law. Such as the fact that Shabbath has to be broken to save a life? That WAS, and IS, the message of Christ, then and now. That is why Jesus was so far from G-d, for he did not understand the Law of the L-rd: " 1 HAPPY IS the man that hath not walked in the counsel of the wicked, nor stood in the way of sinners, nor sat in the seat of the scornful. 2 But his delight is in the law of HaShem; and in His law doth he meditate day and night..." .......... T Ixcatl

For which of these do you stone me?’ “We are not stoning you for any of these,” replied the Jews, “but for blasphemy, because you, a mere man, claim to be God.” Revelation 1:8: Alpha/Omega = Almighty = The One who is to come = Lord God Revelation 21:6-7: Alpha/Omega = Beginning/End = God Revelation 22:12-13: Alpha/Omega = The One who is coming soon = Beginning/End = First/Last Revelation 1:17-18; First/Last = Living One = “I was dead, and behold I am alive forever and ever!” • Isaiah 44:6: “This is what the LORD says— Israel’s King and Redeemer, the LORD Almighty. I am the first and I am the Last; apart from me there is no God.” – also check out Isaiah 48:12-16. • John 1:49: Then Nathanael declared, “Rabbi, you are the Son of God; you are the King of Israel.” John 1:1: “In the beginning was The Word, and The Word was with God, and The Word was God.” John 1:18: “No one has ever seen God (the Father), but God the One and Only, who is at the Father’s side, has made him known.” 2Peter 1:1 “Simon Peter, a servant and apostle of Jesus Christ, to those who through the righteousness of our God and Savior Jesus Christ have received a faith as precious as ours:” and check out Isaiah 43:11… Faith is not won by debate.

content: "http://www.streetprophets.com/storyonly/2009/5/6/20453/45392" Fram Pastor Dan at Street Prophets: quote: This is disturbing: quote: "http://www.abcnews.go.com/Politics/story?id=7513343&page=1" New research shows young Americans are dramatically less likely to go to church - or to participate in any form of organized religion - than their parents and grandparents. "It's a huge change," says Harvard University professor Robert Putnam, who conducted the research. Historically, the percentage of Americans who said they had no religious affiliation (pollsters refer to this group as the "nones") has been very small - hovering between 5 percent and 10 percent. However, Putnam says the percentage of "nones" has now skyrocketed to between 30 percent and 40 percent among younger Americans. Oh, wait. That's not the disturbing part. This is: quote: While these young "nones" may not belong to a church, they are not necessarily atheists. "Many of them are people who would otherwise be in church," Putnam said. "They have the same attitidues and values as people who are in church, but they grew up in a period in which being religious meant being politically conservative, especially on social issues." Putnam says that in the past two decades, many young people began to view organized religion as a source of "intolerance and rigidity and doctrinaire political views," and therefore stopped going to church. There's been some question about the validity of self-reported church attendance numbers: we know that it tends to be overstated, but nobody's really sure by how much. So it's possible that this reflects a new willingness to state the truth, rather than new behavior per se. But in general, thanks a lot, Religious Right. Not only did you help screw up this country by propping up a bunch of venal sociopaths and helping them win election after election, but you also helped undermine the very religion you claimed to defend by convincing an entire generation that it was made up of hateful, narrow bigots. Way to go. Well done, good and faithful servants.

content: Jesus went to the gentiles. He healed the servant of a Roman Centurian. He spoke to the woman at the well, one of the reviled by the Pharisies, Samaritans. His tale of the Good Samaritan concerned the ritual observing Pharasy and the priestly Levite leaving the man to die on the side of the road for fear of ritual uncleanness on the spproaching Sabbath, rather than attend the human needs of the wounded man. To which would you ascribe the the greater charity? To which would you ascribe the character of following the "laws" in spirit, rather than to the letter!! That WAS, and IS, the message of Christ, then and now. Hollow ritual, meaningless observances, or the Godly concern of one human being for another, as addressed in the ten commandments. All through history we can see the difference by Christians, and others of any religion, straying from this simple fact!! Hollow empty observance of ritual and the complete LOSS of the meaning of Christ and all He did and gave to the human race by His simple teachings. All the laws of men are meaningless without simple HUMANITY!!! The spirit of God given to ALL of us at birth and forgotten in the observances of men!! T

The story of the Samaritan is a vile example of Jesus' hatred for his people or his ignorance of the law. Remember, the story never happened it was a TALE. The actual teachings of the Law is that saving a life is above Shabbath. In other words, it is commanded TO BRAKE SHABBATH in orther to save other's life. Someone asked if Jesus lied, well... A sin of omission by Jesus? The TALE of the Samaritan had a purpose, to perpetuate the idea that Jews cannot possible be close to G-d with their human-made rituals! To which would you ascribe the the greater charity? Since this did not happened... who cares! And since the story had the purpose to teach that EVERYONE is capable of compassion exept the Jews, you cannot possible in good faith decide that a person that hates his own people is worth much. That is Paul's teachings. Furthermore, how do you know what you are following (the letter or the spirit) if you ignore the basic contents of the law. Such as the fact that Shabbath has to be broken to save a life? That WAS, and IS, the message of Christ, then and now. content: IX, Your answers are not in bold. They clearly contradict the NT. quote: Is God different than Jesus? Yes. How did Jesus expect us to disciple NATIONS - teaching them His ways? Nobody will ever know if Jesus consider himself to be G-d or if that was an invention of his followers.

All we know about him was written several years after his death. Nobody will ever know if Jesus consider himself to be G-d or if that was an invention of his followers. I was under the impresion that Jesus said not to go to the gentiles, for he had come to the lost of Israel. But again... who knows! Matthew 28:16-20 16 But the eleven disciples proceeded to Galilee, to the mountain which Jesus had designated. 17 When they saw Him, they worshiped Him; but some were doubtful. 18 And Jesus came up and spoke to them, saying, “All authority has been given to Me in heaven and on earth. 19 “Go therefore and make disciples of all the nations, baptizing them in the name of the Father and the Son and the Holy Spirit, 20 teaching them to observe all that I commanded you; and lo, I am with you always, even to the end of the age.” quote: Originally posted by ixcatzin: [QUOTE]Originally posted by GlassOnion: Are Jesus' ways different than God's? Yes, big time! John 20:24-29 24 But Thomas, one of the twelve, called Didymus, was not with them when Jesus came. 25 So the other disciples were saying to him, “We have seen the Lord!” But he said to them, “Unless I see in His hands the imprint of the nails, and put my finger into the place of the nails, and put my hand into His side, I will not believe.” 26 After eight days His disciples were again inside, and Thomas with them. Jesus came, the doors having been shut, and stood in their midst and said, “Peace be with you.” 27 Then He said to Thomas, [color:RED]“Reach here with your finger, and see My hands; and reach here your hand and put it into My side; and do not be unbelieving, but believing.” 28 Thomas answered and said to Him, “My Lord and my God!” 29 Jesus said to him, “Because you have seen Me, have you believed? Blessed are they who did not see, and yet believed.” quote: Originally posted by ixcatzin: [QUOTE]Originally posted by GlassOnion: Was Jesus a liar? Not sure, because there is not written documents left by him. All we know about him was written several years after his death. Nobody will ever know if Jesus consider himself to be G-d or if that was an invention of his followers. Matthew 27:11 11 Now Jesus stood before the governor, and the governor questioned Him, saying, “Are You the King of the Jews?” And Jesus said to him, “It is as you say.” …but that’s just what He says…
reply: That is something someone wrote about him, several years after he died. But if he said all these things, once again, it shows that he had no clue about Jewish law. The Jews were telling him the truth. He should have be stonned for blasphemy, your NT explains it clearly: "You, being a man, make yourself out to be G-d." At the end it does not matter. He died a shameful death and that was the end of him. But be glad, when Messiah comes, he will teach Torah to the nations, and all peoples will come to know HaShem. Ixcatzin
